required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on September 19, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reduced Nicotine Content Cigarettes in Smokers of Lower Socioeconomic Status
clinical_study.official_title: Reduced Nicotine Content Cigarettes in Smokers of Lower Socioeconomic Status

brief_summary.textblock: The overall goal of this study is to address the question of whether progressively lowering nicotine content in cigarettes can reduce or eliminate nicotine dependence in smokers of low socioeconomic status

detailed_description.textblock:
To address the question of whether progressively lowering nicotine content in cigarettes can reduce or eliminate nicotine dependence in low socioeconomic smokers, we will randomize smokers to either an Reduced Nicotine Content group with a gradual step-wise reduction in nicotine from 11 mg to 0.2 mg per cigarette in five 3-wk stages, or a control group with nicotine content similar to their preferred usual brand of cigarettes.
Overall, we hypothesize that low socioeconomic smokers who switch to progressively lower nicotine cigarettes will initially alter their smoking behavior to compensate for lower nicotine until cigarette nicotine yields become so low that complete compensation becomes too difficult. At that point, smokers will either drop-out or continue to smoke the reduced nicotine content cigarettes but with incomplete compensatory behaviors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Dropped Out of Study as a Measure of Adherence
primary_outcome.description: Adherence to the regimen was assessed via dropout (due to withdrawal or lost-to-follow up) during the randomized intervention trial phase of the study. Dropout was analyzed as a time-to-event outcome during the 18 weeks after randomization.

secondary_outcome.description: Baseline participant characteristics were evaluated for their association with the primary outcome, randomized trial phase dropout. The table below reports the number of participants who dropped out by each characteristic that was found to be univariately associated with the primary outcome.
Measured by self-reported cigarettes per day at in-person clinic visits using 6-day follow back
Measured by cotinine (ng/ml) measured in plasma
Measured in carbon monoxide levels by expired CO
Perceived Stress is measured via the Perceived Stress Scale Score. The 10-item version was used. Scale range is 0-40. Higher scores indicate more stress.
Salivary Cortisol Cortisol is produced by the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis (HPA) axis in response to stress. Peak cortisol measures during the cortisol awakening response were used.

arm_group.description: the experimental group will smoke cigarettes with Gradually Reduced Nicotine Content (RNC) (11.6, 7.4, 3.3, 1.4, 0.7, and 0.2 mg per cigarette) cigarettes, each smoked for 3 weeks, except for the last period which will last 6 weeks to evaluate a longer-term adherence to the lowest nicotine content cigarette.
The Same Nicotine Control Group (SNC) will continue to smoke research cigarettes with a usual nicotine content (about 11.6 mg per cigarette)

intervention.description: Cigarettes contain 11.6, 7.4, 3.3, 1.4, 0.7, and 0.2 mg nicotine per cigarette

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-65
- Less than 16 years of education
- Able to understand, and sign consent
- Smoke >4 cigarettes/day for at least a year
- No quit attempt in prior 1 month and not planning to quit smoking within next 6 months
- Plan to live in local area for next 8 months
- Able to read and write in English
- Women not pregnant and taking steps to avoid pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- College graduate
- Use of psychotropic drugs
- Significant medical condition, or immune system disorders, respiratory diseases, kidney or liver diseases or any other medical disorders that may affect biomarker data
- Use of any non-cigarette nicotine delivery product in the past week or smoking cessation medicine in prior 3 months
- Currently pregnant or nursing
- Uncontrolled serious psychotic illness or substance abuse
- History of difficulties providing blood samples-fainting, poor veins, anxiety

overall_official.affiliation: George Washington University School of Public Health

facility.name: George Washington University School of Public Health

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants completed a baseline phase of one week on usual brand cigarettes and another baseline phase on same nicotine content cigarettes (2 weeks). Of these, 35 participants either were lost to follow up or withdrawn from the study during the baseline phase and before they started the intervention.

group.title: Reduced Nicotine Content Cigarettes
group.description: The experimental group will smoke cigarettes with Gradually Reduced Nicotine Content (RNC) (11.6, 7.4, 3.3, 1.4, 0.7, and 0.2 mg per cigarette) cigarettes, each smoked for 3 weeks, except for the last period which will last 6 weeks to evaluate a longer-term adherence to the lowest nicotine content cigarette. Cigarettes contain 11.6, 7.4, 3.3, 1.4, 0.7, and 0.2 mg nicotine per cigarette

group.title: Same Nicotine Content Cigarettes
group.description: The Same Nicotine Control Group (SNC) will continue to smoke research cigarettes with a usual nicotine content (about 11.6 mg per cigarette) Same Nicotine Content Cigarettes: about 11.6 mg nicotine per cigarette

baseline.population: Baseline values for outcomes reflect levels after participants were on the usual nicotine content cigarettes for 2 weeks and before they received the intervention.

Reduced Nicotine Content Cigarettes: Cigarettes contain 11.6, 7.4, 3.3, 1.4, 0.7, and 0.2 mg nicotine per cigarette

group.description: The Same Nicotine Control Group (SNC) will continue to smoke research cigarettes with a usual nicotine content (about 11.6 mg per cigarette) Same Nicotine Content Cigarettes: about 11.6 mg nicotine per cigarette

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: > High School Degree and < Bachelor's degree

measure.title: Plasma Cotinine
measure.description: Samples below the level of detection were set to 3 ng/mL.

measure.description: 10-item version was used. Scale range is 0-40. Higher scores indicate more stress.

outcome.title: Predictors of Participant Dropout
outcome.description: Baseline participant characteristics were evaluated for their association with the primary outcome, randomized trial phase dropout. The table below reports the number of participants who dropped out by each characteristic that was found to be univariately associated with the primary outcome.
outcome.population: Participants (who were randomized) are stratified according to the listed characteristics.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: The experimental group will smoke cigarettes with Gradually Reduced Nicotine Content (RNC) (11.6, 7.4, 3.3, 1.4, 0.7, and 0.2 mg per cigarette) cigarettes, each smoked for 3 weeks, except for the last period which will last 6 weeks to evaluate a longer-term adherence to the lowest nicotine content cigarette. Cigarettes contain 11.6, 7.4, 3.3, 1.4, 0.7, and 0.2 mg nicotine per cigarette. The Same Nicotine Control Group (SNC) will continue to smoke research cigarettes with a usual nicotine content (about 11.6 mg per cigarette).

measure.title: Predictors of Participant Dropout
measure.description: Baseline participant characteristics were evaluated for their association with the primary outcome, randomized trial phase dropout. The table below reports the number of participants who dropped out by each characteristic that was found to be univariately associated with the primary outcome.
measure.population: Participants (who were randomized) are stratified according to the listed characteristics.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is Same Nicotine Content Group.
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of treatment group in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Age Group, Working Status, and BMI.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is reduced nicotine content vs. same nicotine content cigarettes.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is Age equals 18-29.
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of age group (ages 30-39) in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Working Status, and BMI.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is Age group 30-39 to the Age group 18-29.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is Age equals 18-29.
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of age group (ages 40-49) in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Working Status, and BMI.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is Age group 40-49 to the Age group 18-29.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is Age equals 18-29.
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of age group (Ages 50-59) in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Working Status, and BMI.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is Age group 50-59 to Age group 18-29.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is Age equals 18-29.
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of age group (Ages 60-65) in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Working Status, and BMI.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is Age group 60-65 to the Age group 18-29.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is not currently working.
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of working status in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Age, and BMI.
analysis.other_analysis_desc: The direction of comparison is currently working to not currently working.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is BMI Underweight (<18.5)
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of BMI Normal Weight group (>=18.5 & <25) in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Working Status, and Age.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is Normal Weight (>=18.5 & <25) to Underweight (<18.5) group.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is BMI Underweight group (<18.5)
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of BMI Overweight group (>=25 & < 30) in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Working Status, and Age.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is Overweight (>=25 & < 30) to Underweight (<18.5) group.

analysis.groups_desc: The reference group is BMI Underweight group (<18.5)
analysis.p_value_desc: Testing the effect of BMI Obese group (>=30) in a Multivariable Cox Regression Model.
analysis.method_desc: Adjusting for Treatment Group, Working Status, and Age.
analysis.estimate_desc: The direction of comparison is Obese (>=30) to Underweight (<18.5) group.

outcome.title: Cortisol
outcome.description: Salivary Cortisol Cortisol is produced by the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis (HPA) axis in response to stress. Peak cortisol measures during the cortisol awakening response were used.
outcome.population: A subset of participants was randomly selected to complete the cortisol collection procedure and those who provided usable samples 1-3 were used in this analysis

reported_events.desc: Adverse events (AEs) were systematically collected at each study visit by asking participants about any changes in their physical or mental health or if they needed to seek immediate medical care at an emergency room or hospital.

event.sub_title: Reproductive system and breast disorders - Other
Musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorder - Other
Respiratory, thoracic, and mediastinal disorders- Other

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The sample size was not reached due to a shortage of study cigarette inventory.
